data.title: Elizabeth Hurley and husband split
data.meta_description: The model may now be seeing cricketer Shane Warne.
data.text:
The model may now be seeing cricketer Shane Warne.

Express December 13, 2010

Forty five-year-old British model and actor Elizabeth Hurley announced on Twitter that she and her husband, Arun Nayar, have separated.

The news came after a report by the News of the World alleging an affair between Hurley and Australian cricketer Shane Warne. “Not a great day. For the record, my husband Arun and I separated a few months ago. Our close family and friends were aware of this,” Hurley posted on Twitter.

Warne has also split up with his wife, Simone Callahan. “Sadly and unfortunately, Simone and I split up a while ago, our close friends and family were informed at that time. It is a private matter so we did not make it public. We remain friends and will continue to be good parents,” Warne said in a statement on his website.

Warne and Callahan have three children together and had divorced some time ago but had rekindled their romance and shared a home together in his hometown of Melbourne.

Hurley and Warne reportedly met at an English race in July and last month the cricketer announced he would interview Hurley on his new Australian television chat show, called “Warnie”.

Hurley and her husband, Indian businessman Arun Nayar, began dating in 2003 and were wed in March 2007 with two lavish ceremonies set across the globe; with one taking place in a castle in England and the other, in a palace in Jodhpur where Nayar hails from.

Hurley and Nayar’s traditional Hindu ceremony featured Hurley wearing a pink sari and Nayar arriving astride a white horse.

The wedding celebrations were attended by Bollywood stars Preity Zinta and Ness Wadia, Pakistani cricketer-turned-politician Imran Khan, musician Sivamani and even Nikolaos Pavlos, the crown prince of Greece.

However, the wedding ceremony did have its share of problems with makeshift structures being torn down and a scuffle breaking out between journalists and a member of the couple’s security team.

Hurley had previously been involved with British actor Hugh Grant, who she dated for 13 years, and film producer Stephen Bing, with whom she has a son.

Published in The Express Tribune, December 14th, 2010.
